thread.title: Vandals steal keys, equipment from firetrucks
thread.title_full: Vandals steal keys, equipment from firetrucks

title: Vandals steal keys, equipment from firetrucks
text:
Share on Twitter 
Just a day ahead of battling 22 bushfires in the region, vandals broke into the Rydal fire station in the Blue Mountains and ripped out vital two-way radios and stole the keys to two trucks on Friday. 
Lithgow RFS operation officer Gary Hansen told The Daily Telegraph numerous items had also been stolen from the shed. 
Mr Hansen said the thieves took the keys for two of the four fire trucks, as well as taking the handpiece to two of the radios which rendered them unusable. Rydal RFS Volunteer Phil Paton . Picture: John Grainger Source: News Limited 
He said despite having a large number of fires, they were able to manage without the gear. 
“We had plenty of fires, but it didn’t alter our response,” Mr Hansen said. 
He said they were able to locate spare keys for the trucks. 
Phil Paton, a RFS volunteer who lives in Rydal, took to Facebook to vent his anger. 
“So, in the midst of bushfire season with numerous fire calls, and we discover that our ‘Crossroads’ fire shed had been broken into,” he wrote on Facebook. 
“Two trucks vandalised, 2-way radios ripped out, and keys stolen. What brainless f***ed-up morons do this? 
“People’s lives and livelihoods at risk here.” The historic town of Rydal. Source: News Corp Australia
